slides.text: What could you learn if we archived every visible word on New York City’s streets?
Business signs, bumper stickers, advertisement—anything with text.
Non-English text might stand out, a nod to this Mexican enclave in Sunset Park, Brooklyn. [zoom in on spanish sign]
Or the ubiquitous “See something, say something,” deeply embedded in NYC vernacular.
Or the phrases that uniquely blanket NYC [never forget]. If you know, you know.
And search NYC’s text landscape for pretty much anything.
